{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3412119,"name":"Kevin Rowney","username":"krowney_sf","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/d07c76/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-07-30T18:15:16.489Z","cooked":"

Hey all-
New out-of-the-box OMIO x6 here is fully assembled and i’m pretty sure the wiring is fully connected the steppers, spindle, and limit-switches to the controller box.

With the power off, the stepper motors rotate easily.

With the power on, the stepper motors rotate just as easily…contrary to the documentation.

Am focused on this problem, because with Mach3 installed and connected nothing (not even manual jog) works to get motors to move.

Any ideas on how to debug this?

with gratitude,

Kevin

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":26,"updated_at":"2024-07-30T18:15:16.489Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":33,"reads":277,"readers_count":276,"score":235.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":469341,"topic_slug":"brand-new-omio-x6-stepper-motors-are-not-engaging","display_username":"Kevin Rowney","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":67264,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/brand-new-omio-x6-stepper-motors-are-not-engaging/469341/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3412139,"name":"","username":"iz_en_zi","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/iz_en_zi/{size}/226207_2.png","created_at":"2024-07-30T19:20:54.765Z","cooked":"

Not an Omio, but I had the exact same issue on my brand new Shapeoko 4 XXL CNC Router when I got it 2 years ago. Contacted support, turned out the main board was broken, and they sent out a replacement. I’d contact Omio to make sure it isn’t that.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":26,"updated_at":"2024-07-30T19:25:29.853Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":248,"readers_count":247,"score":84.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":469341,"topic_slug":"brand-new-omio-x6-stepper-motors-are-not-engaging","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":48541,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"now a sad alumni"},"post_url":"/t/brand-new-omio-x6-stepper-motors-are-not-engaging/469341/2","custom_user_title":"now a sad alumni","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3412163,"name":"topgun","username":"topgun","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/ba9def/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-07-30T20:52:34.047Z","cooked":"

Double check to make sure your limit switches are wired correctly. Double check to make sure the cables from the router are correctly hooked up to the black router box. Test your z probe against the Mach-3 diagnostics view to see if that is showing the green light when you touch the alligator clip to the main probe aluminum center. Are the switch lights turning on when you power on the router and then the spindle?

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":26,"updated_at":"2024-07-30T20:52:34.047Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":224,"readers_count":223,"score":49.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":469341,"topic_slug":"brand-new-omio-x6-stepper-motors-are-not-engaging","display_username":"topgun","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":10805,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/brand-new-omio-x6-stepper-motors-are-not-engaging/469341/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3412167,"name":"Adam Fleming","username":"AdamF","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/adamf/{size}/234717_2.png","created_at":"2024-07-30T21:02:28.674Z","cooked":"
iz_en_zi:

I’d contact Omio to make sure it isn’t that.

Always a good idea to reach out to the manufacturer or seller for new equipment not working.

I’m the meantime, do you have any pictures or videos of your team trying to get it running?

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":26,"updated_at":"2024-07-30T21:02:28.674Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":201,"readers_count":200,"score":40.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":469341,"topic_slug":"brand-new-omio-x6-stepper-motors-are-not-engaging","display_username":"Adam Fleming","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":41952,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC 3596 Lead Mentor/Alum, FTC 30607 Lead Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/brand-new-omio-x6-stepper-motors-are-not-engaging/469341/4","custom_user_title":"FRC 3596 Lead Mentor/Alum, FTC 30607 Lead Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3412174,"name":"Anand Rajamani","username":"asid61","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/asid61/{size}/7179_2.png","created_at":"2024-07-30T21:34:02.350Z","cooked":"

Reach out to Omio as other have said. If you remove some screws you can take the cover off of the control box and make sure the stepper cables are all plugged into the main control board. Make sure to unplug from AC before doing this.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":26,"updated_at":"2024-07-30T21:34:02.350Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":161,"readers_count":160,"score":32.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":469341,"topic_slug":"brand-new-omio-x6-stepper-motors-are-not-engaging","display_username":"Anand Rajamani","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":21715,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/brand-new-omio-x6-stepper-motors-are-not-engaging/469341/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3412179,"name":"Joe G.","username":"Joe_G","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/joe_g/{size}/2250_2.png","created_at":"2024-07-30T22:20:05.474Z","cooked":"

Make sure you’re fully following the steps for Mach3 installation and profile configuration that came with the machine. If I recall correctly, my machine had the same issue, and there was some non-intuitive thing I had to do to get Mach3 configured correctly because I wrongly figured I knew how to install software and didn’t need to read the instructions step by step.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":26,"updated_at":"2024-07-30T22:23:07.331Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":151,"readers_count":150,"score":35.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":469341,"topic_slug":"brand-new-omio-x6-stepper-motors-are-not-engaging","display_username":"Joe G.","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":6858,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/brand-new-omio-x6-stepper-motors-are-not-engaging/469341/6","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3412181,"name":"Kevin Rowney","username":"krowney_sf","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/d07c76/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-07-30T22:29:16.133Z","cooked":"

Thanks! Yeah, so both switch lights on the front panel are on and the red-led numeric read-out panel is on too. The LED panel shows a blinking “0.00” and does show some quickly flipping digits when I turn the stepper motors manually. So there’s at least one sign that the Controller is getting a signal from from the stepper motors.

The Diagnostics panel only shows “Enable 1” on for the Output Signals and its on all the time and that’s the only Port 1 signal that’s on. It’s on all the time even if I manually trigger the x/y/z stops or manually trigger the probe.

So it kinda looks like I have at least some evidence from Mach3 that the Controller is in touch with the Router, but obviously not all is well.

Doing manual jog via Mach3 does not move a thing, but does show up on the Mach3 console as if the gantry positions are changing; so AFAICT Mach3 >>thinks<< its sending signals.

Do the x/y/z stops show up on Diagnostics for anyone else?

Still feels like its a super-basic problem (even before I should work w Mach3) that the stepper don’t tighten/freeze-up once the power is on.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":26,"updated_at":"2024-07-30T22:32:25.826Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":147,"readers_count":146,"score":34.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":469341,"topic_slug":"brand-new-omio-x6-stepper-motors-are-not-engaging","display_username":"Kevin Rowney","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":10805,"username":"topgun","name":"topgun","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/ba9def/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":67264,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/brand-new-omio-x6-stepper-motors-are-not-engaging/469341/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3412193,"name":"Kevin Rowney","username":"krowney_sf","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/d07c76/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-07-30T23:07:37.329Z","cooked":"

So I totally hear you on the Mach3 install. Lots of details to get right, and its entirely possible I missed one. Might have to just go back and re-install.

Thing is, I’m still stuck on this one point (maybe i should forget about it?):

The motors don’t tighten/freeze up once the Controller power is on

That’s a test that the OMIO documentation insists you do before you even install Mach3, and i’ve been not passing that test the whole time. Mach3 appears to be working in that the position on the screen reported by the laptop is updating when I jog x/y/z; but the machine isn’t actually moving.

Shouldn’t i debug the basic problem of input signals to the stepper motors first?

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":26,"updated_at":"2024-07-30T23:07:37.329Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":133,"readers_count":132,"score":26.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":469341,"topic_slug":"brand-new-omio-x6-stepper-motors-are-not-engaging","display_username":"Kevin Rowney","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":6858,"username":"Joe_G","name":"Joe G.","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/joe_g/{size}/2250_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":67264,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/brand-new-omio-x6-stepper-motors-are-not-engaging/469341/8","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3412202,"name":"Domtech","username":"Domtech","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/domtech/{size}/138487_2.png","created_at":"2024-07-31T00:03:53.611Z","cooked":"
krowney_sf:

The LED panel shows a blinking “0.00” and does show some quickly flipping digits when I turn the stepper motors manually. So there’s at least one sign that the Controller is getting a signal from from the stepper motors

The stepper motors do not have any form of feedback so that is pretty unusual behavior…

The LCD is for the spindle VFD and has nothing to do with the steppers.

Sometimes these control boxes have wires come loose in shipping so that is my best guess for what’s going on.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":26,"updated_at":"2024-07-31T00:03:53.611Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":123,"readers_count":122,"score":39.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":469341,"topic_slug":"brand-new-omio-x6-stepper-motors-are-not-engaging","display_username":"Domtech","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":14045,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Robototes Lead Mech Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/brand-new-omio-x6-stepper-motors-are-not-engaging/469341/9","custom_user_title":"Robototes Lead Mech Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3412376,"name":"FrankJ","username":"FrankJ","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/frankj/{size}/5392_2.png","created_at":"2024-07-31T19:03:00.220Z","cooked":"

The LCD display is part of VFD for the spindle motor. It is independent of the stepper motor. (Ninja-ed) You might try starting the spindle from Mark 3

On the status line generally on the bottom of the Mach III app if there some sort of error referring to the USB. That would mean the Mark III is not communicating with the drive board.

When the Mark 3 is not talking to the machine, it defaults to demo mode.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":26,"updated_at":"2024-07-31T19:04:13.638Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":101,"readers_count":100,"score":25.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":469341,"topic_slug":"brand-new-omio-x6-stepper-motors-are-not-engaging","display_username":"FrankJ","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":15944,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2974 Robot Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/brand-new-omio-x6-stepper-motors-are-not-engaging/469341/10","custom_user_title":"2974 Robot Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3412384,"name":"Kevin Rowney","username":"krowney_sf","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/d07c76/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-07-31T19:30:30.400Z","cooked":"

Helpful. Thank you.

I think i’ve been able to firmly establish that my Mach3 installation is in communication with the Controller, because you can see the status history and it reports a successful connection. There’s also a hard to see bit of text in the lower left corner that indicates USB connection and that’s working as well on my rig.

So, as far as i can tell, Mach3 is showing every sign that its communicating with the Contoller; but there are at least a few signs that the Controller are not in touch with the Stepper motors.

Seems like its time for me to file a support ticket with OMIO and see what they have to say.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":26,"updated_at":"2024-07-31T19:30:30.400Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":10,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":100,"readers_count":99,"score":20.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":469341,"topic_slug":"brand-new-omio-x6-stepper-motors-are-not-engaging","display_username":"Kevin Rowney","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":15944,"username":"FrankJ","name":"FrankJ","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/frankj/{size}/5392_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":67264,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/brand-new-omio-x6-stepper-motors-are-not-engaging/469341/11","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3414346,"name":"Kevin Rowney","username":"krowney_sf","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/d07c76/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-08-09T20:55:01.869Z","cooked":"

Update on this thread in case anyone else is curious.

Your recommendations were quite useful! After some back-and-forth with OMIO technical support (who I found to be quite responsive via email as long as you are patient with timezones) we discovered what might be the problem. After showing them a video of my connections and assembly, they asked for a video of the symptoms I was seeing. Specifically, the manual adjustment on the steppers is easy to turn when the controller is OFF and ON. That’s the symptom that lead me to start this thread.

They then asked me to take off the outer casing of the controller and then, with care, turn the machine on and inspect the Power Supply Unit. There’s a small green led you can see on the inside, and it’s the indicator that the PSU is working.

It was dark/off.

We concluded that the PSU was bused (which they say is pretty rare) and they agreed to send me a new one. I just got it delivered to me by DHL, and i will now >>carefully<< reattach the internal wiring of the controller to the PSU and try again.

Will report back to you all what happens…but I feel hopeful!

Wish me luck, and thank you everyone for your help.

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":26,"updated_at":"2024-08-09T20:55:01.869Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":85,"readers_count":84,"score":52.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":469341,"topic_slug":"brand-new-omio-x6-stepper-motors-are-not-engaging","display_username":"Kevin Rowney","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":67264,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/brand-new-omio-x6-stepper-motors-are-not-engaging/469341/12","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3414452,"name":"Kevin Rowney","username":"krowney_sf","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/d07c76/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-08-10T15:06:16.865Z","cooked":"

So, i replaced the PSU (carefully checking/re-checking/re-re-checking the wiring) and then plugged it in and turned the controller on.

The green led inside the PSU lit up! Also, with the power on the stepper motors are clearly fully engaged since you can’t easily twist the knobs like you can when its off.

So, i’ll say “problem solved” here; except even with all this good news I >>still<< can’t get manual jog to work so obviously something else is wrong as well. When I hit the jog keys, the Mach3 software is reporting on the screen the appropriate axis moving its coordinates…but the motors are not moving. Of course, I hit the “Reset” button after I boot it up BTW

Have done a bunch of Mach3 diagnostics and it’s definitely connected via USB.

I guess i’m now down to:
(+) re-installing Mach3 and re-re-checking the configuration
(+) re-contacting OMIO support who actually were helpful and did get back to me

So I really want to close this issue, but i’m not quite there yet. Progress though! Thanks everyone for their help so far.

Make sure you install Mach3 exactly as Omio informs. If you don’t do that, your port setup will be incorrect.

","post_number":14,"post_type":1,"posts_count":26,"updated_at":"2024-08-10T15:08:43.178Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":13,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":69,"readers_count":68,"score":33.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":469341,"topic_slug":"brand-new-omio-x6-stepper-motors-are-not-engaging","display_username":"Anand Rajamani","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":67264,"username":"krowney_sf","name":"Kevin Rowney","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/d07c76/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":21715,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/brand-new-omio-x6-stepper-motors-are-not-engaging/469341/14","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3414459,"name":"Kevin Rowney","username":"krowney_sf","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/d07c76/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-08-10T16:14:58.721Z","cooked":"

Got it. Will make sure that’s done right on the next re-install.

I was confused about the original factory-default install configuration provided by OMIO. They have a long list of precise installation instructions for this, which I followed with care. It does seem odd to me, though, that the Ports/Pins config for their install appears to designate a zero pin value and zero port value for the x/y/z motors. I updated those configs using guidance from another post I found…to values that did not trigger a complaint in the logs.

It’s confusing to me that the default OMIO install does trigger log complaints, but maybe that’s just the way it works.

Hm, try another computer. I just installed a copy on a Windows 10 machine the other day and it worked fine. You may need to run that redistry edit thing they call out for Windows 7 - it worked for me.

","post_number":16,"post_type":1,"posts_count":26,"updated_at":"2024-08-10T18:41:31.705Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":15,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":74,"readers_count":73,"score":19.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":469341,"topic_slug":"brand-new-omio-x6-stepper-motors-are-not-engaging","display_username":"Anand Rajamani","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":67264,"username":"krowney_sf","name":"Kevin Rowney","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/d07c76/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":21715,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/brand-new-omio-x6-stepper-motors-are-not-engaging/469341/16","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3414510,"name":"Kevin Rowney","username":"krowney_sf","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/d07c76/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-08-11T00:43:48.641Z","cooked":"

Impressed with everyone’s patient attitude here. TYSM

So, i reinstalled Mach3 and carefully followed the instructions (with of course the new PSU in and so forth) and >>JOG NOW WORKS<<. Am so psyched! Bonus: the spindle spins and the probe works.

…but of course, I’m still not done.

I tested the limit switches during jog mode and they just don’t stop the stepper motors at all. You get out to the edge of travel for x or y or z and it hits the limit switch and just keeps going. Bit of a grind noise as well. Can’t be healthy.

I’ve re-re-checked those connections and also the plug for the limits that goes into the back of the machine. All looks good to me.

And when i test the probe for real using Mach3 to find z-zero by automatic slow decent, it stops exactly right. So it looks like I’m at least receiving some signals into the Controller from the outside (in addition to USB-based control.)

I guess i could maybe get out my multimeter and poke around inside the “Limit” cable that goes into the back of the machine just to check…

Suggestions are welcome.

","post_number":17,"post_type":1,"posts_count":26,"updated_at":"2024-08-11T01:19:59.810Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":16,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":69,"readers_count":68,"score":28.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":469341,"topic_slug":"brand-new-omio-x6-stepper-motors-are-not-engaging","display_username":"Kevin Rowney","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":21715,"username":"asid61","name":"Anand Rajamani","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/asid61/{size}/7179_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":67264,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/brand-new-omio-x6-stepper-motors-are-not-engaging/469341/17","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3414520,"name":"Anand Rajamani","username":"asid61","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/asid61/{size}/7179_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-11T02:08:15.368Z","cooked":"

You have to click the “soft limits” button in Mach3 so that it shows a green border. Then hit “ref all home” to let it find the zero, and it should work fine.

A bit of stalling won’t tear apart your machine, but it is best to avoid

Very useful to know. Thank you.

Just tried that, and when i press the “Soft Limits” button; Mach3 gives off that “ding” noise as an error report. The Mach3 log then reports:

“Machine out of limits for SoftLimit Activation”

…even though the machine is definitely not touching any of the triggers. I also tried making sure to zero-out the DRO indicators (using Mach3) just to make sure it wasn’t reacting to those values.

Still sounds like this is a connection problem from the CNC machine to the controller. Does anyone know the pinout for the plug at the back of the machine for “Limits”? It’s a six-holed oriented connector. Thinking I could diagnose potential problems with a multi-meter on that by watching resistance/voltage on some of those lines and manually triggering the limit-triggers.

Grateful for your help.

","post_number":19,"post_type":1,"posts_count":26,"updated_at":"2024-08-11T19:22:02.427Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":18,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":58,"readers_count":57,"score":21.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":469341,"topic_slug":"brand-new-omio-x6-stepper-motors-are-not-engaging","display_username":"Kevin Rowney","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":21715,"username":"asid61","name":"Anand Rajamani","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/asid61/{size}/7179_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":67264,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/brand-new-omio-x6-stepper-motors-are-not-engaging/469341/19","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3414581,"name":"Anand Rajamani","username":"asid61","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/asid61/{size}/7179_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-11T19:41:17.313Z","cooked":"

Try the “ref all home” button first, then enable soft limits. If the DRO thinks it’s out of limits, it won’t work. Also note that the Y axis at least has a range of -800 to 0mm (or something like that) so trying to move in the positive Y after homing will run up against the soft limit.
